sections.heading: Acts, 1998 Reg. Sess., Ch. 110.
Acts, 1998 Reg. Sess., Ch. 110.
When appeal lies to circuit court
sections.text: An appeal shall lie to the circuit court of the county from the final order of the county commission in the following cases: (a) In cases of contested elections tried and determined by such court; (b) in cases of contempt; (c) the establishment and regulation of a r

sections.heading: Procedures for appeals.Any interested person may appeal the final order of the county commission described by the provisions of subdivision (f), section one of this article to the circuit court as a matter of right by requesting the appeal within four months after the final order of the county commi
sections.text: Procedures for appeals.Any interested person may appeal the final order of the county commission described by the provisions of subdivision (f), section one of this article to the circuit court as a matter of right by requesting the appeal within four months after the final order of the county commission is rendered. The appeal shall be determined by trial de novo. Upon receipt of the request for appeal, the clerk of the county commission shall collect the circuit court filing fee therefor and forward the same, together with the final order and the request, to the clerk of the circuit court. The court may require the clerk of the county commission to file with the circuit clerk all or any portion of the record of the proceedings which resulted in the final order. No bond may be required from any party to the appeal. The final order of the county commission shall be stayed pending the appeal proceedings. If, after the appeal is filed in the circuit court, the matter is not brought on for hearing before the end of the second term thereafter, the appeal shall be considered abandoned and shall be dismissed at the cost of the appellant unless sufficient cause is shown for a further continuance. Upon such dismissal, the final order of the county commission is affirmed. No appeal which has been so dismissed by the circuit court may be reinstated after the expiration of the next regular term following such dismissal.

sections.heading: When procedure to be controlled by provisions of this article
sections.text: In any case where there may be an appeal under the preceding section and the manner of appeal is not otherwise specially provided by law, the procedure shall be controlled by the provisions in the following sections of this article; and i

sections.heading: Bills or certification of exceptions for appeal; refusal of commissioner to sign bill or certificate; party availing of error without formal bill
sections.text: At the trial or hearing of any matter by the county court as to which an appeal will lie under section one of this article, a party may except to any opin

sections.heading: Presentation of petition for appeal; when petition must be presented; original record to accompany petition
sections.text: In any case in which an appeal lies under section one of this article on behalf of a party to a controversy in a county court, such party may present to the circuit court of the county in whic

sections.heading: Procedure when appeal allowed.If the appeal be allowed, it shall be docketed and the order of allowance shall specify what bond, if any, is required before such appeal shall take effect, and the petition and record mentioned in the preceding section shall be filed with the clerk of the circuit court
sections.text: Procedure when appeal allowed.If the appeal be allowed, it shall be docketed and the order of allowance shall specify what bond, if any, is required before such appeal shall take effect, and the petition and record mentioned in the preceding section shall be filed with the clerk of the circuit court. A copy of the order of allowance shall be served upon the opposite party, and upon proper return of such service and the execution of the required bond, the appeal shall be proceeded with in the circuit court. The petition shall be heard and determined and the appeal shall be decided upon the original record of the proceeding as defined in the preceding section.

sections.heading: Application to Supreme Court of Appeals when appeal refused by circuit court; action by Supreme Court of Appeals
sections.text: If the appeal be refused by the circuit court, the refusal shall be indorsed on the petition, which, together with the original record mentioned in section four of this article, may then

sections.heading: Procedure upon circuit court's decision
sections.text: After the decision of the appeal by the circuit court, the cause or matter shall be remanded to the county court or be retained in the circuit court and there proceeded with as the circuit court may determine and order.

sections.heading: When appeal, writ of error or supersedeas to be awarded by circuit court or judge
sections.text: An appeal from, or writ of error or supersedeas to, any judgment, decree or order of any court of record of limited jurisdiction established under the provisions of section 19 of article VIII of the Constitution of thi

sections.heading: Certification to appellate courts as to sufficiency of summons, return of service, pleading, motion for summary judgment, etc
sections.text: Any question arising in such court of limited jurisdiction upon the sufficiency of a summons or return of service, upon a challenge of the sufficiency of a pleading or the ve

sections.heading: Petition for writ of error, appeal or supersedeas
sections.text: Any person who is a party to any controversy in such court of limited jurisdiction, wishing to obtain a writ of error, appeal or supersedeas, may present a petition therefor to the circuit court of that county, or the judge thereof in vacation, which

sections.heading: Time for appeal or writ of error; notice of intent to file petition in criminal cases to be filed with clerk stating grounds
sections.text: No petition shall be presented to the circuit court or judge for an appeal from, or writ of error or supersedeas to, any judgment, decree or order rendered or made by such cou

sections.heading: Stay of proceedings; bond.At the instance of any person who desires to present such petition, the court of limited jurisdiction, in which the judgment, decree or order is, may, during the term at which it is rendered or made, or the judge of such court may, within twenty days after such term is ende
sections.text: Stay of proceedings; bond.At the instance of any person who desires to present such petition, the court of limited jurisdiction, in which the judgment, decree or order is, may, during the term at which it is rendered or made, or the judge of such court may, within twenty days after such term is ended, upon notice in writing to the opposite party (in either case the court or the judge exercising a discretion), make an order suspending the execution of such judgment, decree or order, for a reasonable time to be specified in such order, when such person shall give bond before the clerk of such court, in such penalty as the court or judge may require, with a condition reciting such judgment, decree or order, and the intention of such person to present such petition, and providing for the payment of all such damages as any person may sustain by reason of such suspension in case a supersedeas to such judgment, decree or order should not be allowed and be effectual within the time so specified.

sections.heading: Filing of petition; transmission of petition and record; payment of expenses and fees; compensation of clerk; return of record
sections.text: Such petition, together with a copy thereof, shall be first filed in the office of the clerk of the court of limited jurisdiction wherein the judgment, decree or order compl

sections.heading: Order showing action of circuit court on petition; second petition; application to Supreme Court of Appeals or judge thereof
sections.text: The circuit court or the judge thereof, upon consideration of the petition, shall enter an order granting or refusing it. If the circuit court or judge deems the judgment, dec

sections.heading: Certiorari for omitted portion of record
sections.text: The circuit court may, in any case, award a writ of certiorari to the clerk of the court of limited jurisdiction, and have brought before it, when part of a record is omitted, the whole or any part of such record.

sections.heading: Allowance of appeal or writ of error or supersedeas; stay of proceedings
sections.text: The court or judge to whom a petition is duly presented, if of opinion that the decision complained of ought to be reviewed, may allow an appeal, writ of error or supersedeas, and may stay proceedings either in whole or in part

sections.heading: Docketing case.If upon a petition as aforesaid the appeal, writ of error or supersedeas to a judgment, order or decree be allowed by the circuit court or judge, the appeal, writ of error or supersedeas shall be docketed in such court
sections.text: Docketing case.If upon a petition as aforesaid the appeal, writ of error or supersedeas to a judgment, order or decree be allowed by the circuit court or judge, the appeal, writ of error or supersedeas shall be docketed in such court.

sections.heading: Issuance of summons and supersedeas; order of publication; service and return of certified copy of order
sections.text: The clerk of the circuit court shall thereupon issue a summons against the parties interested, other than the petitioners, that they may be heard, and also issue any supersedeas which may be awar

sections.heading: Indorsements on writs as to bond
sections.text: The clerk of the circuit court shall indorse on the summons or supersedeas, or on the certified copy of the court order in lieu thereof, that it is not to be effectual until the bond required by the following section, with good personal security, be given before the

sections.heading: Appeal bond.Except when an appeal, writ of error or supersedeas is proper to protect the estate of a decedent, convict or insane person, the same shall not take effect until bond is given by the appellants or petitioners, or one of them, or some other person, in a penalty to be fixed by the court or
sections.text: Appeal bond.Except when an appeal, writ of error or supersedeas is proper to protect the estate of a decedent, convict or insane person, the same shall not take effect until bond is given by the appellants or petitioners, or one of them, or some other person, in a penalty to be fixed by the court or judge by or in which the appeal, writ of error or supersedeas is allowed or entered, with condition as provided in section fourteen, article five of this chapter; and all the provisions of section fifteen of said article, relating to indemnifying bonds and additional bonds, shall apply in the case of an appeal, writ of error or supersedeas under the provisions of this article.

sections.heading: Time for presenting and giving bond
sections.text: No process shall issue upon any appeal, writ of error or supersedeas allowed by a circuit court, or in the case of an order of rejection the Supreme Court of Appeals, or judge of either of such courts to or from a judgment, decree or order, if, when the record is

sections.heading: Time and manner of hearing.The order of priority of hearing causes pending in circuit courts upon an appeal, writ of error or supersedeas from courts of limited jurisdiction shall be such as the Supreme Court of Appeals shall prescribe under the provisions of section nineteen, article five of this c
sections.text: Time and manner of hearing.The order of priority of hearing causes pending in circuit courts upon an appeal, writ of error or supersedeas from courts of limited jurisdiction shall be such as the Supreme Court of Appeals shall prescribe under the provisions of section nineteen, article five of this chapter for causes pending in the Supreme Court of Appeals. Any cause so pending in a circuit court, unless for good cause shown a continuance of the hearing to a future term of the court be granted, may be heard at the next term of court after the appeal, writ of error or supersedeas is granted: Provided, That no cause shall be heard until all proper process has been served as provided in section eleven of this article, and all proper bonds have been taken as provided in section thirteen of this article. The manner of hearing shall be such as the circuit court shall prescribe.

sections.heading: Petition to be heard and case decided upon original record
sections.text: For the purpose of hearing and determining the petition and deciding the appeal or writ of error in the circuit court, no transcript of the record shall be made, but the petition shall be heard and determined and the appeal or writ of error

sections.heading: Judgment of circuit court; appeal or writ of error to Supreme Court of Appeals
sections.text: The circuit court, where an appeal, writ of error or supersedeas has been allowed by such court or the judge thereof in vacation, shall, upon the hearing thereof, affirm such judgment, decree or order if there be no error

sections.heading: Procedure after circuit court's decision of the appeal or writ of error
sections.text: When, after reversal, the case is retained in the circuit court for a new trial or hearing on further proceedings, it shall be docketed and proceeded in to final judgment or decree in the same manner and with the same effect as

sections.heading: Writ of error to judgment quashing indictment
sections.text: Notwithstanding anything hereinbefore contained in this article, whenever in any criminal case an indictment is held bad or insufficient by the judgment or order of any court of record of limited jurisdiction, the state, on the application of the Attorne

sections.heading: When law and rules governing appeals to Supreme Court of Appeals to apply
sections.text: In any instance where this article fails to provide a specific method of procedure on appeals from courts of limited jurisdiction to circuit courts, the law and rules applying in the matter of appeals from circuit courts to th

sections.heading: When appeal lies.(a) A party to a civil action may appeal to the Supreme Court of Appeals from a final judgment of any circuit court or from an order of any circuit court constituting a final judgment as to one or more but fewer than all claims or parties upon an express determination by the circuit
sections.text: When appeal lies.(a) A party to a civil action may appeal to the Supreme Court of Appeals from a final judgment of any circuit court or from an order of any circuit court constituting a final judgment as to one or more but fewer than all claims or parties upon an express determination by the circuit court that there is no just reason for delay and upon an express direction for the entry of judgment as to such claims or parties:Provided, That an appeal of a final order or judgment of a circuit court entered after June 30, 2022, shall be to the Intermediate Court of Appeals, as required by §51-11-1et seq. of this code.(b) As provided in §51-11-10 of this code, a party in interest may petition the Supreme Court of Appeals for appeal of a final order or judgment of the Intermediate Court of Appeals in accordance with rules promulgated by the Supreme Court of Appeals.(c) The defendant in a criminal action may appeal to the Supreme Court of Appeals from a final judgment of any circuit court in which there has been a conviction, or which affirms a conviction obtained in an inferior court.

sections.heading: Certification to Supreme Court of Appeals
sections.text: Any question of law, including, but not limited to, questions arising upon the sufficiency of a summons or return of service, upon a challenge of the sufficiency of a pleading or the venue of the circuit court, upon the sufficiency of a motion for summary ju

sections.heading: Presentation of petition.A party desiring to appeal, seeking the original jurisdiction of the Supreme Court of Appeals, or seeking an opinion of the court on certified questions may file a petition in accordance with rules of appellate procedure promulgated by the Supreme Court of Appeals
sections.text: Presentation of petition.A party desiring to appeal, seeking the original jurisdiction of the Supreme Court of Appeals, or seeking an opinion of the court on certified questions may file a petition in accordance with rules of appellate procedure promulgated by the Supreme Court of Appeals.

sections.heading: Time for appeal.The time for filing a notice of appeal, perfecting an appeal, and filing related documents with the Intermediate Court of Appeals and the Supreme Court of Appeals shall be in accordance with rules promulgated by the Supreme Court of Appeals
sections.text: Time for appeal.The time for filing a notice of appeal, perfecting an appeal, and filing related documents with the Intermediate Court of Appeals and the Supreme Court of Appeals shall be in accordance with rules promulgated by the Supreme Court of Appeals.

sections.heading: Stay of proceedings pending appeal; supersedeas bond; post-conviction bail
sections.text: A petition for stay of proceedings pending appeal, supersedeas bond or post-conviction bail relief shall be filed and processed in accordance with rules of appellate procedure promulgated by the Supreme Court of Appeals.

sections.heading: Filing of petition.Petitions for appeal shall be filed and processed in accordance with rules of appellate procedure promulgated by the Supreme Court of Appeals
sections.text: Filing of petition.Petitions for appeal shall be filed and processed in accordance with rules of appellate procedure promulgated by the Supreme Court of Appeals.

sections.heading: Contents of transcript of record
sections.text: The contents of the transcript of record shall be governed in accordance with rules of appellate procedure promulgated by the Supreme Court of Appeals.
